# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the Julia code for your request:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[\s-]" => "_")
end
```
This function `clean_column` takes a string `col`, converts it to lower case, removes leading and trailing white spaces using the `strip` function, replaces any spaces or hyphens with underscores using the `replace` function. The regular expression `r"[\s-]" => "_"` is used to replace all instances of either a space or a hyphen with an underscore in the input string.
